Build Configuration¶

Convenience classes for dealing with dictionary-based configuration

class webmynd.config.BuildConfig[source]¶

Parses a JSON-encoded build configuration and offers convenient lookup

get(keys, default='__ nonsensical default')[source]¶

Lookup a configuration value.

For example, if we’d previously parsed a file with:

{"section": {"subsection": {"key": "value"}}}

as its contents:

>>> build_config.get('section.subsection.key')
'value'
>>> build_config.get('section.subsection.not_here', default='default val')
'default val'
Parameters:
  • keys – dot-separated key names to drill into configuration
  • default – value to return if the specified configuration is not found
Returns:

requested configuration value, or the default if not found
Raises KeyError:
 

if no default is given, and the requested configuration value isn’t found
parse(config_file)[source]¶

Read and parse a JSON build configuration file

Parameters:config_file – name of the file to read in
Raises Exception:
 if the named file doesn’t exist
